CatDescriptText: Mrs. Gladys Clemons, hotel worker, of 722 Clarissa Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taxpayers would oppose a raise in taxes to build new schools and to repair old ones which may be or might soon become fire traps?" answer reads: "I believe that most people would make the sacrifice and approve a raise in taxes for the benefit of the schools. I know myself that I'm not able to pay a raise in taxes; however, if it's going to save a life, a child's life-well-I would just have to make the sacrifice."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gladys Clemons, wearing dark head scarf and button down coat with collar, belt, and buttoned shoulder decoration, standing in front of wooden door with peeling paint and lock, thermometer with advertisement for Braun's Town Talk bread hanging on left
